com.genband.mobile.api.services.call

Interface CallServiceInterface


  • public interface CallServiceInterface
    Interface used to access to the internal call service implementation.
    Since:
    2.0.0

    • Method Summary

      CallApplicationListener is no longer used. Switch to CallService#createOutgoingCall(String, OutgoingCallCreateInterface) instead

      void setCallApplication(CallApplicationListener callApplication)
      Sets the call application interface which will be used to make call backs to the application layer This method should be called immediately after receiving the call service instance (for once)

    • Method Detail

      • setCallApplication

        void setCallApplication(CallApplicationListener callApplication)
                 throws MobileException
        Sets the call application interface which will be used to make call backs to the application layer This method should be called immediately after receiving the call service instance (for once)
        Parameters:
        callApplication - the call back target implemented in the application
        Throws:
        MobileException - when the application listener provided is null
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        CallApplicationListener

      • createOutgoingCall

        void createOutgoingCall(java.lang.String terminatorAddress,
                        CallApplicationListener callApplication,
                        OutgoingCallCreateInterface callInterface)
        Deprecated. CallApplicationListener is no longer used. Switch to CallService#createOutgoingCall(String, OutgoingCallCreateInterface) instead
        This method is to create outgoing/mobile originated calls.
        Parameters:
        terminatorAddress - address defining the target of the call (remote party)
        callApplication -
        callInterface - base interface for outgoing call creation events
        See Also:
        createOutgoingCall(String, OutgoingCallCreateInterface)

                        java.lang.String terminatorAddress,
                        CallApplicationListener callApplication,

        This method is to create outgoing/mobile originated calls
        Parameters:
        originatorAddress - address defining the source of the call
        terminatorAddress - address defining the target of the call (remote party)
        callApplication -
        callInterface - base interface for outgoing call creation events
        See Also:
        createOutgoingCall(String, String, OutgoingCallCreateInterface)

      • createOutgoingCall

        void createOutgoingCall(java.lang.String originatorAddress,
                        java.lang.String terminatorAddress,
                        OutgoingCallCreateInterface callInterface)
        This method is to create outgoing/mobile originated calls
        Parameters:
        originatorAddress - address defining the source of the call
        terminatorAddress - address defining the target of the call (remote party)
        callInterface - base interface for outgoing call creation events

      • createOutgoingCall

        void createOutgoingCall(java.lang.String callId,
                        java.lang.String originatorAddress,
                        java.lang.String terminatorAddress,
                        CallApplicationListener callApplication,
                        OutgoingCallCreateInterface callInterface)
        Deprecated. CallApplicationListener is no longer used. Switch to CallService#createOutgoingCall(String, String, String, OutgoingCallCreateInterface) instead
        This method is to create outgoing/mobile originated calls and it will set callId for that call. Identifier (callId) is NOT related with SPiDR session id
        Parameters:
        callId - Id of call. If this set as null MobileSDK will generate a callId.
        originatorAddress - address defining the source of the call.
        terminatorAddress - address defining the target of the call (remote party).
        callApplication - application listener for call service.
        callInterface - base interface for outgoing call creation events
        See Also:
        createOutgoingCall(String, String, String, OutgoingCallCreateInterface)

      • createOutgoingCall

        void createOutgoingCall(java.lang.String callId,
                        java.lang.String originatorAddress,
                        java.lang.String terminatorAddress,
                        OutgoingCallCreateInterface callInterface)
        This method is to create outgoing/mobile originated calls and it will set callId for that call. Identifier (callId) is NOT related with SPiDR session id
        Parameters:
        callId - Id of call. If this set as null MobileSDK will generate a callId.
        originatorAddress - address defining the source of the call.
        terminatorAddress - address defining the target of the call (remote party).
        callInterface - base interface for outgoing call creation events

      • createThreeWayCall

        void createThreeWayCall(java.lang.String firstCallId,
                        java.lang.String secondCallId,
                        CallApplicationListener callApplication,
                        OutgoingCallCreateInterface callInterface)
        Deprecated. CallApplicationListener is no longer used. Switch to CallService#createThreeWayCall(String, String, OutgoingCallCreateInterface) instead
        This method creates 3-Way Call (a.k.a Ad-Hoc Conference Call). 3-way call basically merges the two call sessions (A-B and A-C) between 3 parties into one conference call. This API should be called from the party, which is in both sessions, to initiate the "join" operation.
        Parameters:
        firstCallId - specifies the first call which will be joined to ThreeWay Call
        secondCallId - specifies the second call which will be joined to ThreeWay Call
        callApplication - application listener for call service.
        callInterface - base interface for outgoing call creation events
        Since:
        4.4.8
        See Also:
        createThreeWayCall(String, String, OutgoingCallCreateInterface)

      • createThreeWayCall

        void createThreeWayCall(java.lang.String firstCallId,
                        java.lang.String secondCallId,
                        OutgoingCallCreateInterface callInterface)
        This method creates 3-Way Call (a.k.a Ad-Hoc Conference Call). 3-way call basically merges the two call sessions (A-B and A-C) between 3 parties into one conference call. This API should be called from the party, which is in both sessions, to initiate the "join" operation.
        Parameters:
        firstCallId - specifies the first call which will be joined to ThreeWay Call
        secondCallId - specifies the second call which will be joined to ThreeWay Call
        callInterface - base interface for outgoing call creation events
        Since:
        4.4.8

      • rotateCameraOrientationToPosition

        void rotateCameraOrientationToPosition(ScreenOrientation orientation)
        This Method is used for rotating outgoing video
        Parameters:
        orientation - is the orientation for the camera
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getActiveCalls

        ImmutableList<CallInterface> getActiveCalls()
        Returns the active call objects.
        Returns:
        Immutable call list
        Since:
        4.0
